H0.text: A neutral one is produced when equal amounts of a strong acid such as hydrochloric acid are mixed with a strong base such as sodium hydroxide.

H1.text: A economical one is the result when equal amounts of a strong acid such as hydrochloric acid are mixed with a strong base such as sodium hydroxide.

H2.text: A lateral one is the result when equal amounts of a strong acid such as hydrochloric acid are mixed with a strong base such as sodium hydroxide.

H3.text: A thermodynamic one is the result when equal amounts of a strong acid such as hydrochloric acid are mixed with a strong base such as sodium hydroxide.

A4.text: When a strong acid reacts with a strong base the neutralization reaction can be written as H+ + OH− → H2O

A5.text: The pH of such a solution is close to a value of 7; the exact pH value is dependent on the temperature of the solution
